reviews.review_msg: Dave was an awesome teacher, but I've never heard of him giving anything higher than an A- (and very few of those too!). Still, he was very helpful and extremely committed to the students/course. He does expect you to work hard though!
oops last post had a typo. had him fall 07..not 08!

Had Jon as a TA fall 08. great TA! was very helpful. always available to go over papers and questions about exams. very fair marker. serious students (i.e., non-slackers) will appreciate his interest and knowledge about crim theories.
Awesome TA, extremely helpful, and fair marker.
Professor Lysova's lectures provide insight into contemporary issues relating to social behaviours and criminality. Highly recommended!
Thanks to you people who never went to lecture she does not post lecture slides anymore

It's a mandatory class and she seems to be the only one teaching it recently... seems to love the biological perspectives of crime? Doesn't post slides online and zooms through things that aren't in the textbook and cannot be found anywhere... likes to show movies and video clips, criteria on syllabus completely changed by TA's for assignments >:(

I took this last spring, and my marks have improved immensely (B+ to A+). Hilary actually takes time to criticize your work, other TAs don't. You can't LEARN unless u accept your flaws. If you want to learn, she is super helpful. If you want to cruise through uni w/out academic improvement, then suit yourself -- she's not easy, but she is the best.

Yes, she's hard - but really fair.  She stayed extra hours for office hours and was willing to go through my essay line by line to help me with my writing.  My essay marks have gone up a full grade since. She is focused on helping students to achieve the very best possible.
HORRIBLE TA. STAY AWAY FROM HER. Not useful. Only focuses on wrong APA practices. Doesn't even discuss about the paper content. She's horrible.

Barry is an interesting character, I still do not find him as entertaining as others.  The TA does all of the marking and the marking scheme is well laid out.  I found Aimee (TA) to be quite nice although she may look unapproachable, if you have a problem she will help you out, you just have to try and approach her.

Very fun lecturer, and I couldn't complain. The material was interesting and relevant. The essays were easy if you did the readings. Why do so many people dislike Amy? She's a good TA, just strict about plagiarism. If you follow the most recent form of APA, and take her advice to heart, she won't deduct marks. I think you're all patch-writers.

I liked Barry.  He was entertaining (though mildly inappropriate) and very approachable.  The TA, Aimee Smith, on the other hand had some rather interesting ideas on APA format and tended to focus her marking on her own skewed perception of the format.  Still got an A, but the lady needs to take a refresher course.

its a writing course so there were a lot of papers. The midterm was a take home essay which i found beneficial=) he keeps his lectures interesting and he's pretty funny. Good ppt but you need to attend lectures because he post partial sections online so you have to come lol. Be prepared to write and read critically its not just a slack class

very predictable and straight forward with exams and papers. a presentation and participation are worth a lot and bump up your mark. does powerpoint notes that are pretty much the textbook--so u don't need to do the readings. plus, a really helpful and nice guy.
Considering this is a writing intensive course, Asheka is a pretty easy marker. Didn't really learn anything new but I would much rather take an easy marker over some of the other crazy TA's at SFU.
Had him for a TA. Awesome guy, would take again.

She's the most down to earth, friendly and helpful person I've met. She's smart and really encouraging. I think she has qualities that other profs are sorely lacking. I hope I get her in a seminar or something.

Sarah was an amazing prof. I went into this class struggling to write a compeling an good paper. I ended up getting a really bad grade on my proposal but she worked with me to better my writing skills to the point where I felt confident handing in my finals draft. Her lectures are inspiring and she is engaging with students.

Professional & prepared. thorough guidelines but lengthy. Knows what she's talking about, helpful in emails & office hours. Prof Y was always quick to respond to me, let me come to office hours for a different class when I couldnt make it on mondays. Grading was tough but reasonable & I think she bumped in the end.

Prof took the time to meet with me and work through any questions. Wish I took this class before the end of my uni. Very passionate about what she teaches and knowledgeable too. Clearly knew her stuff and made it relatable and easy to understand too. Very accessible, approachable and a great teacher. BUT the TA was disconnected and mean.

Amazing TA! Gave great detailed feedback and was always happy to help.  I have never had a TA care as much about helping me learn before. Understands and explains theory well! Gives good feedback. I would take a class with her again.
Tried to make uninteresting material bearable.
